description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Improved cloud worker UX in web: cleaner full-page shell, progressive disclosure, and worker delete/custom domain support.
- Added explicit session turn segmentation in app chat (intent, execution, result) to make tool-heavy runs easier to scan.
Fixes & polish
- Hardened Den runtime DB behavior against transient MySQL disconnect/reset conditions.
- Fixed messaging reliability for empty router prompt replies and reduced inbox refresh churn from auth memo changes.
- Softened 502 behavior in web worker flows and documented updated hosted worker architecture.
Packaging / ops
- Release bump to 0.11.117 across app, desktop, orchestrator, server, and router packages.
- AUR metadata updated for this release line.
